newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian bank says further $10.6 mln Minfins frozen.
newsitem.headline: Russian bank says further $10.6 mln Minfins frozen.

text.p: Police in Russia's Samara region have frozen a further $10.6 million nominal of MinFin bonds, a senior official at Vneshtorgbank, the main depositary for MinFin bonds, said on Friday.

Andrei Remnyov, deputy head of Vneshtorgbank's depositary, told Reuters the freezing of the bonds, in connection with a criminal investigation into the theft of the bearer bonds, was in addition to the arrest of $129,000 of bonds frozen by Moscow police, which was announced on Thursday.
"We disseminated information today to clients about the new freezing of bonds of the fourth and fifth tranches," Remnyov said.
Vneshtorgbank issued the following details of the bonds, which were frozen on May 16:
The fourth tranche of the bonds matures in 2003 and the fifth tranche in 2008.
